definition: poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with

sentences.english: An edict has been issued temporarily abolishing the land tax in Shantung, as the people are unable to pay it owing to the famine.
sentences.chinese: 饑荒使農民無力納稅，山東已發佈法令臨時取消田賦。

sentences.english: The land-tax system is one of important items in Xinjiang's taxation during the Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 田賦制度是清代新疆賦稅制度的重要內容之一。

sentences.english: In addition, they were forced to pay innumerable surtaxes , to say nothing of the government land tax.
sentences.chinese: 除了田賦以外，他們還被迫交納多如牛毛的各種雜捐。

sentences.english: The last, appraise the achievement of the land tax reform in 1930s.
sentences.chinese: 最後對30年代田賦整頓的成績進行評價。

definition: taxation/in former times, esp. land tax
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
administrative unit (e.g. province 省[sheng3], prefecture 地區|地区[di4 qu1] or county 縣|县[xian4])
to recover (stolen property)/to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils
fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
